result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin R Mustache was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
05/28/2015 CORRECTED TO REMOVE THE SEVERITY FROM THE PARTY TO A CRIME CHARGE. 

Dodge Correctional Institution as reception facility. 
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Concurrent with: Barron County Case 10CF142.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must maintain absolute sobriety. 
Must not associate with anyone who is a known drug dealer or user of controlled substances.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must submit DNA sample and pay the surcharge.

Defendant Devin R Mustache in court with attorney Lauren Olivia Otto.  Defendant Devin R Mustache in custody.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 10CF142 AND 14CF311
8:07  Court relates and gives appearances. 8:10  Atty. Otto relates and asks that today's hearing be considered as a resentencing.  Court and counsel stipulate.
8:22  State relates. 8:23  Court and counsel relates. 8:32  Court questions defendant regarding review of PSI.

10CF142 (RESENTENCE HEARING):
Count #1:  Court indicates there was an imposed and stayed sentence.  Issue has been held open as to jail credit.  
Court and counsel stipulate that as of the last hearing, 387 days credit was correct, and that sentence that as was handed down is correct.
Amended JOC to be prepared for this count, to change portion on bottom of JOC from  "It is adjudged that 523 days sentence credit are due..." to "It is adjudged that 387 days sentence credit are due..."
Count #4:  
Court imposes same sentence today as in 11/05/2014 (which was consecutive to count #1)
Court, counsel and defendant stipulate to court's prior sentence.
Given stipulation of court, counsel and defendant, court imposes same sentence today as was handed down on 11/05/2014.
Pay court costs.
Amended JOC to be prepared for this count.
Written explanation of determinate sentence given to defendant.
Voter ineligibility form signed.

14CF311 (PLEA HEARING):
Count #1:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Count #3:  State moves to dismiss and read in.  Court grants motion.
Count #5:  State moves to dismiss and read in.  Court grants motion. Count #7:  State moves to dismiss and read in.  Court grants motion.
Count #9:  State moves to dismiss and read in.  Court grants motion.
PSI ordered.
Sentence hearing set for 5/15/15 at 2:00 PM.
Bond is revoked.
